title: what is the best design films / documentaries that you've ever seen in your life?
content:
For an example I really enjoyed  
-Art and Copy - Advertising Design & Past and Future of Design  
-Helvetica - Typography & Graphic Design  
-Objectified - Industrial Design & Functionality
author: Ken W

comments.content:
The only one that has ever made an impact on me was [Why Man Creates](http://web.archive.org/web/20120508011811/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Why_Man_Creates) by Saul Bass.

I saw this numerous times in school, and it has stayed with me ever since.

"Allah be praised, I've just invented the zero."  
"What?"  
"Nothing."

"Wadda ya doin?"  
"I'm a painting da ceiling."  
"I'm a painting da floor."

Here is a [taste](http://web.archive.org/web/20120508011811/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=3nHOWkfGFsk)

\>For an example I really enjoyed

If you deconstruct the movie “The Fifth Element” you learn more about design than any of the films you mention.

Ah "The Fifth Element". I have to agree with Si on that one.

"Multipass"

There were two that stuck with me, well sorta. I remember a film about C and R Eames and a film which I believe was called, "Design Wars". It documented the design proposals for the Chicago Library. To help facilitate the vetting process, all entrants had to commit to a prototype/mock up/model that would cost no less than one million dollars. [http://www.movierevie.ws/movies/1654447/Design-Wars.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120508011811/http:/www.movierevie.ws/movies/1654447/Design-Wars.html)

"This Is Spinal Tap", specifically the part where they hire a designer to create a "Stonehenge" stage prop.

(Wish I had a more serious recommendation, but I'm drawing a blank.)
hold on a second, you mean The Fifth Element starring Bruce Willis? I think I have that on tape haha
I liked the film about [Max Bill](http://web.archive.org/web/20120508011811/http:/de.movies.yahoo.com/m/max-bill-das-absolute-augenmass/index-7733790.html) very much.

The 1958 documentary "American Look" is worth watching. It's propaganda for General Motors, sure, but as a historical artifact of design culture, it's fascinating. You can watch the whole thing on YouTube (about 30 minutes).

love this one!
"Why Man Creates" looks epic. I gotta track that down.

\> what is the best design films / documentaries that you've ever seen in your life?

none. this is the nonsense category.
If you're in a retro mood, the [films of Charles and Ray Eames](http://web.archive.org/web/20120508011811/http:/snoreandguzzle.com/?p=149) are fun.
